intro: Galium helveticum var. elongatum, commonly known as the elongated woodcrushers, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a hairy texture, and it is often found in temperate regions.
